alert.note: Alert for Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Southampton and northeastern Sussex Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 803 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Homeville, or 10 miles southwest of Wakefield, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Southampton and northeastern Sussex Counties, including the following locations... Vicksville, Dory, Newville, Berlin, Booker, Lumberton, Manry and Littleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
